data.message: Facebook, PLEASE leave my newsfeed alone!  I keep changing it to most recent and you keep changing it to top stories!  YOUR idea of what a top story is does not agree with mine.

replies.message:
Hi Joyce. You can adjust what you see in your News Feed by hiding stories you don't want to see, by following or unfollowing friends and using friends lists, and by choosing to view stories in the order they're posted. Learn how at: http://on.fb.me/1tzW87T
-Chantal
It would be a lot easier if when I change it to Most Recent, it STAYED!  I would be hiding stories all day.
I agree. Most recent in general is what I prefer. That's not a real option. I have former students who rarely use FB (because it's for old people), but when they do, I want to see what they posted.

I agree. I also wish we could change it to see most recent to least recent because with "top stories" I see the same posts over and over again in random order when I log on and I don't get to see everyone's post.
I agree. I want it to stay set at "most recent."
Why would I want to unfollow friends?
Don't you love how FB outright just ignores your questions or just gives you answers that don't even answer your questions. I hate this site with a passion.
I can't even do that on iphone. Or I can't figure it out. I'll see a post from last Wednesday at the top. I want to see most recent posts
